materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Small amount of Contrast B (01628 Hot Orange) for Nose.
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Body: (make 2 pieces alike for Front and Back).
**With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 28 sc.**
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 42 sc. Fasten off. 
Join front and Back: With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join 
MC with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in 
same sp as sl st. (Miss next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next 
sc) 8 times. Fasten off. 
head: (make 2). Work from ** to ** as given for Body. Fasten off.
Overlap each piece of Head over opening at top of Body and sew in 
position, leaving opening free as shown in photo. 
Scarf: With A, ch 38. 
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten 
off. 
fringe: Cut lengths of A 3" [7.5 cm] long. Take 3 strands tog, fold in half 
and knot into fringe at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
hat: With A, ch 21. Join with sl st to form a ring, taking care not to twist 
chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 
2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made) 3 times. 
18 sts rem. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 15 sts rem. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 12 sts rem. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 9 sts rem. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 6 sts rem. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 3 sts rem. Fasten off. Break yarn. Thread 
yarn through rem sts pull tightly and fasten securely.
nose: With B, ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. Fasten off.
finiShing
Sew on beads for eyes. Sew Nose in position. Sew 3 buttons to front of 
Body for decoration. Secure center of Scarf at back of Body. Put on Hat 
and tie Scarf to keep opening closed.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 505 Aruba Sea A, 316 Soft White B, 319 Cherry Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Notions: Tapestry needle, stitch marker, any size food container, spray starch (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Models fit 17½ x 14” (44.5 x 35.6 cm) clear plastic grocery store bakery container. Finished measurements Directions are given for Wrappers to fit a container with a 17½” (44.5 cm) circumference.
gauge: 8 sts and 7 rows sc = 2” (5 cm). Snowflake Motif Version 1 = 4” (10 cm) in diameter, Snowflake Motif Version 2 = 3½” (9 cm) in diameter.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Snowflake Sweet Treat Wrapper Present a gift of food with a clever crocheted wrap! We’ve shown one on a clear food container, but you can use them however you please! Mix and match the two widths of bands with the two snowflake designs in whatever colors suit you.

Snowflake Motif 1 (looped spokes) With desired color, make an adjustable ring. Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc. Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, ch 2, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, ch 2; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-2 spaces. Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, *skip next st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-2 spaces. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (slip st, ch 7, slip st) in next ch-2 space, skip next sc, *sc in each of next 3 sts, (slip st, ch 7, slip st) in next ch-2 space, skip next st, sc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-7 loops. Round 6: Ch 1, slip st in first st, slip st in each of next 2 sts, ([3 sc, ch 3] 3 times, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space, *slip st in each of next 3 sc, ([3 sc, ch 3] 3 times, 3 sc) in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—18 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Repeat using colors A, B and C for desired number of snowflake motifs.

Snowflake Motif 2 With desired color, make an adjustable ring. Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc. Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, ch 3, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-3 spaces. Models fit 17½ x 14” (44.5 x 35.6 cm) clear plastic grocery store bakery container. Add or subtract chain stitches and rows as necessary to fit own container.

NOTES This snowflake inspired gift wrapper is a fast & easy project designed to be used as both a decorative embellishment & a securing strap for food containers as well as jars. Snowflake motifs and strap band widths and color designs can be mixed and matched in a variety of ways. Furthermore, snowflakes can be made easily removable for use as a tree decoration by simply tying the motif onto the band, rather than sewing. Or leave the snowflake motif off entirely. To get a custom fit, plan your design using the dimension of your container & a gauge swatch. Using a tape measure wrapped all the way around the container or jar to be used record the measurement and subtract 1 - 2” (2.5 x 5.1 cm) to allow for negative ease. This will insure a tight fit. Determine the number of starting chains required based upon your gauge swatch & number of sts per inch compared to the container dimensions. Straps are worked in rows & overlapped about ½” (12.7 mm) (or more as needed) and seamed together. Band should fit tightly over the container to prevent slipping off and to aid in securing the food container top.

Finished measurements Directions are given for Wrappers to fit a container with a 17½” (44.5 cm) circumference. Wrappers can be adjusted based on size of gift container. Snowflake Motif 1 = 4” (10 cm) in diameter, Snowflake Motif 2 = 3½” (9 cm) in diameter. RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins Designed by Nancy Anderson

What you will need: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 505 Aruba Sea A, 316 Soft White B, 319 Cherry Red C

Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]

Notions: Tapestry needle, stitch marker, any size food container, spray starch (optional)

GAUGE: 8 sts and 7 rows sc = 2” (5 cm). Snowflake Motif Version 1 = 4” (10 cm) in diameter, Snowflake Motif Version 2 = 3½” (9 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Continued...

RHC0501-020155M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019 CROCHET SKILL LEVEL EASY SHOP KIT SNOWFLAKE SWEET TREAT WRAPPER | CROCHET 1 of 2

Page 2 of 2
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in next st, skip next st, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space, *skip st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-3 spaces. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (slip st, [ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in each of next 2 ch, slip st in ch-3 space] twice in next ch-3 space, *skip next st, sc in each of next next 3 sts, (slip st, [ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in each of next 2 ch, slip st in ch-3 space] twice in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Snowflake Motif Finishing Wet finished motif, flatten and straighten snowflake spokes, allow to dry. For extra flattening, cover damp motif with waxed paper and place heavy book on top until motif is dry. Optional: Spray with laundry starch to stiffen as desired.

Wrapper Band (wide version) Direction are given for a container with a 17½” (44.5 cm) in circumference. Adjust size to fit own container as indicated in the pattern notes. Specific color patterns of samples are found after pattern directions. With Row 1 color, ch 62. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across—61 sc. Row 2: Rotate to work across end of Row 1, ch 1, work 3 sc in row-end sc; rotate to work across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, turn—64 sc. Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), hdc in first 61 sts, working around the end, 2 sc in each of next 3 sts, hdc in each of last 61 sts, turn—128 sts.  Row 4: With designated color, ch 2, hdc in each of first 61 sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each of next 2 sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each of last 61 sts—132 hdc. Fasten off. Row 5: With right side facing, join Row 5 color with a slip st in first st or Row 4, ch 1, sc in each of first 63 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, sc in each of last 63 sts—135 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Wide Wrapper Band Color Sequences Wide Version A Rows 1-3: A. Row 4: B. Row 5: C. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 1 in B.

Wide Version B Row 1-4: B. Row 5: A. Middle Accent: Two strands of C held together as one. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 1 in C.

Wide Version C Row 1-4: C. Row 5: A. Middle Accent: Two strands of B held together as one. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 2 in A.

Narrow Wrapper Band Direction are given for a container with a 17½” (44.5 cm) in circumference. Adjust size to fit own container as indicated in the pattern notes. Specific color patterns of samples are found after pattern directions. With Row 1 color, ch 66. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across—65 sc. Row 2: Rotate to work across end of Row 1, ch 1, work 3 sc in row-end sc; rotate to work across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across, turn—68 sc. Row 3: With designated color, ch 1, sc in each of first 65 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each of last 65 sts, turn—135 sc. Fasten off. Join Row 4 color. Row 4: With Row 4 color, ch 1, sc in each of first 66 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in each of last 66 sts. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Narrow Version A Row 1-2: B. Row 3: A. Row 4: C. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 1 in A. Narrow Version B Row 1-3: C. Row 4: B. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 2 in B. Narrow Version C Row 1-3: A. Row 4: C. Middle Accent: Two strands of B held together as one. Pictured with Snowflake Motif 2 in C.

Finishing Middle Accent (optional) Thread 2 strands of designated yarn onto yarn needle, weave through the holes created by working both sides of the starting ch, in the center of the finished band. Secure the yarn ends neatly on wrong side of band. Wrap band tightly around gift container and pin ends, overlapping the rounded edge about ½” (1.3 cm) or more as needed. Sew through both layers neatly around the curved end to prevent puckers when band is stretched. Likewise, turn the band inside out and sew the loose opposite end to the underneath side of the band. Weave in ends. With matching color yarn, sew snowflake over the overlapped portion of the band or thread yarn through the band and the centered snowflake and tie on with a bow for easy removal for use as tree decoration. Alternatively, leave motif off, weave yarn along center and tie in small yarn bow.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Ounce each No. 311 White CA and 390 Hot Red CB; 6 yards No. 389 Hunter Green CC.
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC = colors A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cap measures approximately 4” wide x 5 1/2” tall and holds a standard size gift card.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAP: With CA, ch 26.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 25 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back lp only of each sc across, changing to CB in last st; turn.
Rows 3 and 4: With CB, rep Row 2, changing to CA in last st of Row 4.
Rows 5-28: Rep Row 2, alternating 2 rows CA and 2 rows CB until 7 stripes of each color have been completed, ending with 2 rows of CB. Fasten off.
Pompom: Working into row ends, join CB with a sl st in upper right corner st; * ch 10, sl st in end of next row; rep from * across. Fasten off.
LEAF (Make 2): With CC, ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, 5 dc in next ch, working along opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch; join with a sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a 12” end for sewing.
FINISHING: Sew back seam. Fold up brim. Flatten cap and tack bottom opening closed. Sew Leaves to brim; embroider several French Knot berries with a doubled strand of CB.
Tie: Make a chain 12” long. Weave chain through cap directly under Pompom row. Insert gift card. Pull tie tightly to close top opening of cap and form a pompom. Tie ends together to form hanger.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays™ Cotton (80 g/2.8 oz; 126 m/138 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
Body: (make 2).
**With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around.
Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 28 sc
**
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 42 sc.
Fasten off.
Join Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back tog, join MC with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Miss next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 8 times. Fasten off.
Head: (make 2).
Work from ** to ** as given for Body.
Fasten off.
Overlap each piece of Head over opening of front and back of Body and sew in position, leaving front and back of Head open.
Scarf: With A, ch 38.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of A 3" [7.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Hat: With A, ch 21. Join with sl st to first chain to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 21 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made) 3 times. Join. 18 sts rem.
4th, 6th, 8th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 15 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 12 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 9 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 6 sts rem.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 3 sts rem. Fasten off. Break yarn. Thread yarn through rem sts, pull tightly and fasten securely.
Nose: With A, ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew beads for eyes. Sew Nose in position. Secure center of Scarf at back of Body. Put on Hat to keep opening closed. Sew 3 buttons to front of Body for decorations.

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pants measure 19" in circumference x 8" tall (48.5 x 20.5 cm), excluding suspenders.
gauge: 12 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Boot Sole
With A, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc. 
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc. 
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.

Boot Leg
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in each st around. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 6: Hdc in each st around. Repeat last round until piece measures 2¼" (5.5 cm), working sc in last st of last round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.

Pant Cuff
With B, ch 32; taking care not to twist, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in each ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.

First Pant Leg
With right sides facing and matching sts, position Round 2 of pant cuff over last round of boot leg. 
Round 1: Working through both thicknesses, join C with slip st in any st, ch 2, hdc in each st around. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Hdc in each st around. Repeat last round until pant leg measures 2" (5 cm), working sc in last st of last round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.

Second Pant Leg
Work same as first pant leg but do not fasten off.

Upper Pants
Hold pant legs with right sides and first sts together.
Round 1: Working through both thicknesses from wrong side, hdc in first 8 sts; working in pant leg with right side facing, hdc in next 24 sts around to other pant leg, hdc in remaining hdc of other pant leg—48 hdc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Hdc in each st around. Repeat last round until upper pants measure 2" (5 cm), working sc in last st of last round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off.

Waistband
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), tr in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 tr. 
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc. Fasten off.

Suspenders
Lay piece flat and place markers on front and back for suspenders. 
Row 1: Join C to first marked st on front, ch 40, slip st in corresponding marked st on back, turn, hdc in each ch across to front, slip st in next st of waistband, turn.
Row 2: Hdc in each st across, slip st in next st of waistband. Fasten off. For 2nd suspender, repeat between remaining set of markers.

Belt
With A, ch 3. 
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook, *dc in bottom loops of previous dc; repeat from * until belt measures 20" (51 cm). Fasten off.

Buckle
Round 1: With D, ch 9, dc in 6th ch from hook, ch 1, dc in first ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, weave belt through Row 1 of waistband and buckle.
Weave in ends.
Optional: Cut 2 strands of florist’s wire slightly longer than suspenders. Weave wires through suspenders, working ends into waistband.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (0319) 1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
Contrast B Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Contrast C Saffron (0234) 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast D Minty (0520) 1 ball or 38 yds/35 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Motif: Approximately (Approx) 1¼" [3 cm] square. Finished Sleeve: Approx 2½ x 3¾" [6 x 9.5 cm]
instructions:
Make 2 Motifs of each:
Version 1: Color 1 = A / Color 2 = B
Version 2: Color 1 = C / Color 2 = D
Version 3: Color 1 = D / Color 2 = A
Version 4: Color 1 = B / Color 2 = C
Version 5: Color 1 = D / Color 2 = B
Version 6: Color 1 = C / Color 2 = A
MOTIF
With Color 1, chain (ch) 2.
See Diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 8 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. Fasten off Color 1.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next sc.** 1 sc in next sc. Repeat (rep) from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Following Assembly diagram on page 2, sew Motifs together (tog), using any color, through back loops only with whipstitch (see page 2).
With Wrong sides (WS) tog, fold work in half lengthways. With RS facing, join A with sl st on right-hand side of fold. Ch 1. Work 18 scbl evenly up right side edge, working through both thicknesses. Fasten off A.
With RS facing, join B with sl st on left-hand side of fold. Ch 1. Work 18 scbl evenly up left side edge working through both thicknesses. Fasten off B.
With RS facing, join C with sl st on top right edge. Ch 1. Work 24 scbl evenly around opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
measurements: Gift card holder measures 2½” (6 cm) tall and 4” (10 cm) wide.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Card Holder (Make 2)
With A, ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in second chain from hook and next 15 ch.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of the next 16 sc.
Fasten off. Join B.
Rows 5-6: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each of the next 16 sts.
Fasten off. Join A.
Rows 7-10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of the next 16 sts.
Fasten off.
Buckle
With C, ch 8; join with a slip st to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 3 sc in ring, ch 2, 4 sc in ring, ch 2, 3 sc in ring, ch 2, 4 sc in ring, ch 2; slip st to first sc to join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming later.
FINISHING
With yarn needle and long tail, and using the photo for placement, attach the buckle to the center belt on the front of the gift card holder.
Place the front and back of the gift card holder together with wrong sides facing. Join A to the top left corner of both pieces. (Do not join the top long edge. It will remain open.) Working down the short edge of the card holder, sc in each row of the next 10 rows, sc into same corner st, sc in each of the next 16 sts across the long edge, 2 sc into corner st, sc in each of the next 9 sts along short edge.
Fasten off.
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DKTM Superwash (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 2½” [6 cm] long x 1¼” [3 cm] wide.
instructions: With Color 1, ch 10. With Color 2, ch 1. Break Color 1. Turn chain up-side down, so “bumps” are facing you. 1st rnd: With Color 2, working in top loops only, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Work in rem loops of foundation chain, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 2 sc in first ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Make 1 Leaf using A as Color 1 and B as Color 2. Make 2 Leaves using B as Color 1 and A as Color 2. Arrange 3 Leaves on gift tag and glue in place. Use B as tag string.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 10 (White: 400 yds/320 m; Colors: 350 yds/320 m)
TREE: Myrtle Green (0484) or Wasabi (0397) 1 ball
HEART: Atom Red (2160) or Soft Mauve (1040) 1 ball
GNOME: Main Color MC White (0001) 1 ball, Contrast A Silver (0435) or Aqua (0450) or Atom Red (2160) 1 ball, Contrast B Soft Mauve (1040) or Atom Red (2160) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Craft Paper Tags 3¼" x 2¼" [7.5 x 5.5 cm].
White or Glitter Glue. (Use caution with colored glue on white as it may stain and not dry clear.)
abbreviations: Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (3 times). Yoh and draw through all 3 (4) loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Tree: Approx 2¼" x 2" [5.5 x 5 cm], Heart: Approx 1½" x 1½" [4 x 4 cm], Gnome: Approx 3" x 1¼" [7.5 x 3 cm], Snowflake: Approx 1½" x 1½" [4 x 4 cm]
instructions:
Stiffening the ornaments
Use white glue or glitter glue mixed with water. ¼ water to ¾ glue. Cover top of a box with waxed paper. Pin ornament flat to top of box. Paint glue mixture onto ornament saturating it well. Let dry for at least 10 hours before removing pins.

TREE
See Diagram on page 5. 
RIGHT SIDE OF TREE
Ch 7. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc. 
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn
4th row: Ch 6. Working in back of chain,  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem 3 sts unworked. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 6 sts. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts. 
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sts. 
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn. 
10th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 7 sc. 
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sts. 
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 
16th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 5 sc. 
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
18th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
19th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts. 
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off, leaving a 16" [40.6 cm] tail.

LEFT SIDE OF TREE
With RS facing join yarn with sl st at last unworked sc of 3rd row. 
1st row: Ch 6. Working in back of chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 4th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 6th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 6 sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts. 
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 8th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 4 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 10th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 7 sc. 
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 12th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 5 sts. 
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 14th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 3 sts. 
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.  
13th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 16th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 5 sc. 
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 18th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 3 sts. 
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.

17th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Sl st to top of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Fasten off, leaving a 16" [40.5 cm] tail.
Assembly on gift tag:  Place Double Stick Tape on front of gift tag and press crocheted piece firmly in place. Use regular tape to attach small ornament hook on the back of the gift tag. Stamp or print in ink “To" and “From” . 

GRANNY SQUARE HEART 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to  
first st.
See Diagram on page 5.
Make Magic Loop. Video here.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in magic loop. (Ch 2. 4 dc) 3 times in magic loop. Ch 2. Join. Pull tail to tighten, closing center hole.
2nd rnd: Sl st through back loop only in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [(Ch 2. 4 dc) twice in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 2. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 3 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Sl st in next ch-2 sp. (Skip next 4 dc. 12 tr in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 4 dc. Sl st in next ch-2 sp) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

GRANNY SQUARE GNOME 
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
See Diagrams on page 6.
Beard 
With MC, make Magic Loop. Video here.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in magic loop. (Ch 2. 4 dc) 3 times in magic loop. Ch 2. Join. Pull tail to tighten, closing center hole.
2nd rnd: Sl st through back loop only in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Skip next 4 dc. 12 tr in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 4 dc. 4 dc in next ch-2 sp. Join A. Do not fasten off.
Hat (Worked in rows)
1st row: With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first dc of 2nd rnd. Turn. Cont working in rows. 
2nd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 15 dc in ch-10 sp. Turn. 15 dc.
3rd row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 13 sts. 
4th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 11 sts. 
5th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 9 sts. 
6th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 7 sts. 
7th row: Ch 2. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.  
8th row:  Ch 2. Skip first st Dc3tog. Ch 2. Sl st to top of last st. Fasten off. 
Nose
Note: Atom Red hat-use Atom Red for nose. Pastel color hats-use Soft Mauve for nose.
With B, make Magic Loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a generous tail to sew nose on and pull through loop. Center nose below hat on top of the two 4-dc in 1st rnd of Granny Square. Stitch into place. Weave in ends.
Pom-Pom
With MC, make Magic Loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in magic loop. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off, leaving a generous tail to sew pom-pom on and pull through loop. 
Stitch to tip of hat, weave in ends.
Stiffen after assembly.

pattern_name: Santa & His Elf Crochet Gift Bags
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Hot Red (0390) 3 balls or 825 yds/755 m
Contrast B Spring Green (0672) 2 balls or 710 yds/650 m
Contrast C Black (0312) 1 ball or 275 yds/252 m
Contrast D White (0311) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Contrast E Gold (0321) 1 ball or 68 yds/62 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and pull through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc. Join all rnds with sl st to first st. Santa: Use A as Color 1. Use C as Color 2. Use D as Color 3. Use E as Color 4. Elf: Use B as Color 1. Use C as Color 2. Use A as Color 3. Use E as Color 4.

Bag Bottom and Side Panels (make 3 alike)
With Color 1, ch 33.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 32 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Bag Front and Back Panels (make 2 alike)
With Color 1, ch 49. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 48 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Join Panels:
Arrange Panels to form a box, having Side Panels opposite each other.
With WS of 2 Panels tog, join Color 1 with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly along side edge. Fasten off.
Rep for rem Panels.

Join Bottom to Panels:
With RS of Bottom facing, place lower edge of joined Panels behind Bottom with WS of work tog, aligning corner of Bottom with joining rows of Panels. Join Color 1 with sl st.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around all 4 sides of Bottom. Join. Fasten off.

Feet and Legs (make 2 alike)
With Color 2, ch 10.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 5 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Join. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 32 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 44 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Sc3tog. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 38 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Sc3tog. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 32 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Sc3tog. (Sc2tog) twice.1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 26 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Hdc2tog. Dc3tog. Hdc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 22 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Break Color 2. Join Color 3. 
Stuff Feet firmly.
11th rnd: With Color 3, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join.
12th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
15th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 3. Join Color 1.
16th rnd: With Color 1, 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 16th rnd until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Legs to bottom front edge of Bag as shown in photo.

Belt
With Color 2, ch 161.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 160 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Belt around center of Bag as shown in photo.

Belt Buckle
With Color 4, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Belt Buckle to center front of Belt as shown in photo.

Buttons (make 2)
With Color 3, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Sew Buttons to Front of Bag as shown in photo.

Straps (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 73.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 72 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Straps 1" [2.5 cm] down from top edge and 3" [7.5 cm] in from sides. Attach 1 end to Front Panel and other end to Back Panel.
